alert.note: Alert for Campbell; Scott (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 06 at 3:50PM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east Tennessee, including the following counties, Campbell and Scott. * WHEN...Until 530 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is still possible in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain is estimated to have fallen in the last 2 hours. Additional light rainfall is possible. Runoff is likely to continue for the next hour. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... La Follette, Jacksboro, Huntsville, Jellico, Caryville, Winfield, Royal Blue, Elk Valley, Cove Lake State Park, Ketchen, Norma, Smokey Junction and Indian Mountain State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
